thread.title_full: Best Oscars Dresses From Academy Award Winners - What to Wear to the Oscars

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Best Oscars Dresses From Academy Award Winners - What to Wear to the Oscars
text:
Sure, Oscar winners are selected long before the nominated actresses ever set foot on the red carpet, but, for the sake of this post, let's pretend that what an actress wears has some sort of psycho-spiritual influence on the final outcome. In that case, it would benefit the actress, when choosing her outfit for the big night, to channel as many winning Oscar looks as possible in order to increase her chances, right? Sure! Why not? But what makes a winning Oscar dress? What ties them all together, besides the fact that they were worn by the winners? What necklines, silhouettes, and colors have been worn most often by actresses when accepting their awards? Cosmopolitan.com looked back over the last 30 years of Oscars fashions to find out.
1. Color Of all the colors an actress could wear to accept her Oscar, black is by far the most popular. In the past 30 years, 32 percent of the winners for Best Actress and Best Supporting Actress have chosen it over all the rest. White came in second with 25 percent, with every other color falling far, far behind.
